title: Frame Transaction
description: Add a new transaction type whose validity and gas payment can be defined abstractly. Instead of relying solely on a single ECDSA signature, accounts may freely define and interpret their signature scheme using any cryptographic system, enabling post-quantum security and native account abstraction.
author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), lightclient (@lightclient), Felix Lange (@fjl), Yoav Weiss (@yoavw), Alex Forshtat (@forshtat), Dror Tirosh (@drortirosh), Shahaf Nacson (@shahafn)
laymanDescription: A new transaction type that lets your account use any method to prove you authorized it, not just the current signature system. This enables quantum-resistant signatures, smart wallets with features like recovery and spending limits, and lets others pay your transaction fees natively.

improveUX.description: Enables native account abstraction with flexible wallets supporting social recovery, multi-sig, spending limits, passkeys, and gas sponsorship without trusted intermediaries.

endUsers.description: Better wallet UX with flexible security options, gas sponsorship, and future-proof quantum-resistant signatures.

appDevs.description: Native account abstraction infrastructure simplifies onboarding and enables new interaction patterns.

walletDevs.description: Must implement new transaction type and frame structure, but gains native AA capabilities without bundler dependencies.

toolingInfra.description: Indexers and explorers need to parse new transaction type and per-frame receipts.

layer2s.description: Can implement same transaction type for cross-layer AA consistency.

stakersNodes.description: Validators process new transaction type with frame-based execution model.

clClients.description: No direct changes required for consensus layer.

elClients.description: Significant implementation: new transaction type, four new opcodes, frame execution model, modified receipt structure, and mempool validation rules.

benefits: Provides off-ramp from ECDSA to post-quantum secure signature schemes
Enables native account abstraction without ERC-4337 bundler overhead
Supports gas sponsorship and ERC-20 fee payments natively
Flexible frame structure satisfies diverse AA community goals
tradeoffs: New mempool DoS vectors require ERC-7562-style validation restrictions
ORIGIN opcode behavior changes for frame transactions
